article.Body:
With steel industry in crisis globally, it becomes of paramount importance to fence the Indian steel industry, says Ravi Uppal, MD & CEO of JSPL.

Speaking to CNBC-TV18’s Rituparna Bhuyan, Uppal says that the industry will ask for a minimum import prices from the government, which will be based on reasonable cost of production. China is the largest import of high grid steel followed by Japan and Korea.

JSPL’s steel capacity stands at 7.5 million tonnes currently, he says. The main focus is on utilizing this capacity to the fullest, he adds.
